intro: Lepidagathis plantaginea, commonly known as the small-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, exhibiting a low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white to pale purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warm season. Its leaves are narrow, fleshy, and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, aiding in water retention. Lepidagathis plantaginea is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
